metadata.title: CVE-2021-30884 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
The issue was resolved with additional restrictions on CSS compositing.This issue is fixed in tvOS 15, watchOS 8, iOS 15 and iPadOS 15. Visiting amaliciously crafted website may reveal a user's browsing history.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-30884` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.34.1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.34.1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.34.1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.34.1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.34.1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37-gtk2 - 2.34.1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.34.1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: webkit2gtk package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.34.1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
qtwebkit-opensource-src package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
wpewebkit: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
